org.latency4j.processing

Class LatencyProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • org.latency4j.processing.LatencyProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class LatencyProcessor
extends java.lang.Thread

    A thread implementation which processes durations generated from monitored operations. This class makes it possible for duration processing to take place asynchronously from the execution thread.

    Internally, this class uses a queue to hold the incoming durations of completed operations. These are asynchronously removed from the queue and then processed, triggering any relevant alerts.

    See Also:
    AsynchronousLatencyMonitor, AsynchronousLatencyMonitorFactory

        Constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()

        Asynchronous duration processing logic. This method dequeues durations from the inbound queue, processes them and triggers any relevant alerts. After processing it persists the durations to storage using the persistence manager specified for the requirement to which the duration relates.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • processTaskCompletion

        protected void processTaskCompletion(LatencyRequirement requirement,
                                     WorkDuration duration)

        Queues the duration for a completed operation so that it can be processed asynchronously.

        Parameters:
        requirement - The requirement to which the duration relates.
        duration - The duration to be processed.
